nodes.text: Hath the Darkness arisen?
Wait, Red... is that you? How long has it been since I last saw you? Have you become the hero I knew you could be?

It is so hard to judge the passage of time caught between the living and the shadow. I still stand strong, but there are times when I have doubts. Terrible doubts... Please, tell me Red... what happened to you?
Wait... no! You are not Red, nor has the Darkness come again.
I must not fall into despair. I must not lose faith. I must stand strong when the Darkness returns.
Is there something I can do for you? Something to help you remain strong in your convictions and not be lost to despair?
I am Sir Hans of the Knights Luminar. I have fought in the wars against the Dark Ones. I have faced betrayal, cruelty, exile, and have been blamed for the death of innocents.
I have sworn by my honor and my soul to face the Darkness that will soon rise again. The Knights Luminar created this problem; the Knights Luminar must end it.
And yet, I find myself fading. I died in my bed instead of on the field of glory. Nothing I did seems meaningful now. It's all lost in the shadows of the past.
If only I had a sign that what I did in life was meaningful. That I, Hans, made a difference in someone else's life.
My apprentice, Red, do you know him? Has he done well for himself? Is he now a hero?

nodes.name: The Ghost of Sir Hans
nodes.description:
I met the ghost of Sir Hans today. He remains a ghost in this world so that he can stand against the return of Darkness, which sounds like a good thing. But he sounds like he's fading away from his own doubts.

If only I could find some way to restore his faith... Maybe find something about his old apprentice, Red... Then maybe Sir Hans would be strong again.

nodes.text: Sorry, but I've never heard of Red before. It's been a long time. He's probably dead by now, too.
Go then, lad. There is nothing you can do here. Leave an old ghost to fight against the demons of his own doubts and fears.
Hey, you helped to save the world long ago. You did good. You did your job. You're famous. You've got your very own tomb and there are stories about you and what you did.
There's no need for you to hang around here haunted by doubts and fears. You earned your rest. Let other people deal with what's going on. Let them be heroes, too.
I have sworn an oath to rise against the Darkness in aid of those who need me. I must not forswear my honor. I must be remain true to my words.
Go! Do not tempt me to give up with your words of solace. I will fight my own battles.
Let me see if I get this straight - you're a ghost and yet you're haunted by doubts and fears. That's kind of ironic.
Look, you're dead. Get over it. This tomb just ghost to show that you should just shade away.
Begone, Demon! Your taunts will not dissuade me from my duty! I must stand strong!
Yikes, the Necramulet I've got on is like an icycle around my neck.
It's so cold. I guess that's where they get the expression "cold as the grave."
I'm freezing. I'd better get out of here.
Red, is that you? How are you? Have you become the hero you were meant to be?
Here, sir, is proof that Red was every bit as much a Hero as you were...
A medal of honor? Tell me, lad, what does it say?
The medal says, "To Rufus "Red" MacMurtry for saving Sardonia. Honor, Valor, and Duty forever."
I am so proud of you, Red. Thank you. I now know that what I did in life lives on through you and other heroes. My doubts are vanquished. I shall stand strong when I am again needed.
Hark now and heed my words, lad!

nodes.name: Ghostly Warning
nodes.description: I showed the Medal of Honor to Sir Hans and he seemed pleased. Then he said some very strange words to me. Something about not lingering on my path... Duty will call me to cross an ocean of doubt, Valor will shield me through flames, and Honor give direction through the winds of Chaos... Remember and you will find your way...  At least, that's what I remember. It may be important.

nodes.text: Do not linger long on your path. Duty will call you to cross an ocean of doubt, Valor will be your shield when the flames close in about you, and Honor will give you direction through the winds of Chaos. Remember that and you will find your way.
No, it is not yet my time. I will hold fast against the Darkness. I will uphold my vows of honor.
I must not let my doubts destroy my resolve.
